what: To define a data frame, use the following steps:
title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: Define vectors columns data frame. Note: vector length. Suppose x, y, z three columns data frame. Combine columns form data frame command data_frame(,b,c).
code: library(generatervis) ## basic example code x <- c(3,5,9,7) y <- c("place_1","place_2","place_3","place_4") z <- c("x1","x2","x3","x4") df <- data_frame(x,y,z) print(df) #>   x       y  z #> 1 3 place_1 x1 #> 2 5 place_2 x2 #> 3 9 place_3 x3 #> 4 7 place_4 x4

title: Title — data_frame
text: x Column 1 data frame y Column 2 data frame z Column 3 data frame

title: Title — data_frame
code: x <- c("a","p") y <- c(12.56,38) z <- c("abc","pqr") data_frame(x, y, z) #>   x     y   z #> 1 a 12.56 abc #> 2 p 38.00 pqr
